channel.title: A physical switch doesn't act in the software (solved ü§òüèª)
channel.description: Hi, I'm a new in the axoloti community but I've some programming skills derived from Nord Modular and Reaktor softwares. I'm planning to build a physical multi fx unit to process different incoming signals (piezos and audio in) with axoloti board. At the moment the structure is the seguent: Audio in/piezo pickup - delay - filter - reverb (also a pitchshifter with pre/post delay switch) I've soldered 12 knobs and 2 switches to the gpio ports and assigned midi CCs to all the parameters I want to control. Knobs acts correctly with response in the software and audio result but switches do not. Here's my patch, someone knows what's missing? Thanks a lot Ps. This patch isn't updated with logic/change between gpio/in and midi/intern/cc

item.title: A physical switch doesn't act in the software (solved ü§òüèª)

@KF78 wrote:

Amazig!!! Now it works correctly!! Thank you very much big boss üèª

item.title: A physical switch doesn't act in the software (solved ü§òüèª)
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

The trig inlet of midi/intern/cc should come from the logic/change, the v inlet from gpio/in/digital, you have those swapped around for the buttons.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.source: A physical switch doesn't act in the software (solved ü§òüèª)

item.title: A physical switch doesn't act in the software (solved ü§òüèª)
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

You connected the logic level from gpio/in/digital to the trigger input of midi/intern/cc, while the value inlet is left unconnected, that means it will only transmit zero when you press your button.
You should trigger midi/intern/cc when the logic level from gpio/in/digital changes, use logic/change to detect changes and generate the trigger for midi/intern/cc, and connect the logic level to the v inlet of midi/intern/cc.

Read full topic
item.source: A physical switch doesn't act in the software (solved ü§òüèª)

item.title: A physical switch doesn't act in the software (solved ü§òüèª)
item.dc:creator: @KF78 KevinFollet
item.description:
@KF78 wrote:

Hi,
I'm a new in the axoloti community but I've some programming skills derived from Nord Modular and Reaktor softwares.

I'm planning to build a physical multi fx unit to process different incoming signals (piezos and audio in) with axoloti board.

At the moment the structure is the seguent:
Audio in/piezo pickup - delay - filter - reverb (also a pitchshifter with pre/post delay switch)

I've soldered 12 knobs and 2 switches to the gpio ports and assigned midi CCs to all the parameters I want to control. Knobs acts correctly with response in the software and audio result but switches do not. Here's my patch, someone knows what's missing?
Thanks a lot

image.jpeg1917x881 235 KB

Ps. This patch isn't updated with logic/change between gpio/in and midi/intern/cc
